reviews.text: Adjacent and connected to Sendai train station, this is a very convenient location for business or pleasure in Sendai. Rooms are standard Japanese style (read : small) but with all you would require. Prices are reasonable too. Only cable LAN, no wifi in most rooms, as in the case in many Japanese hotels. Carry a pocket router if you want to use wifi on your iPad, phone, etc. Very handy in Japan. Free wifi in the lobby area. Breakfast spread is fairly extensive and has both western and Japanese selections. Nothing to complain about, other than hard pillows, which I was am sure I could have gotten changed, but was just too lazy.
reviews.title: Great location and service

reviews.text: For us, Sendai was a rest stop for our Sapporo to Fukuoka JR train trip. We needed a hotel that was close to the Shinkansen and clean and reasonably priced. this hotel fits the bill. to me, this hotel is just good for sleep and shower. Its nice and clean but I didn't feel really comfortable in the room. Perhaps its because its an old old hotel and did a so so job at upgrading. So it feel "semi-new" but not comfy as that I would want to curl up with a book and relax in the hotel room. But as a place to rest and shower, it does the job.
reviews.title: Overnight Stay is Just Right!

reviews.text: As others say this hotel is immediately adjacent to the Sendai train station and is connected via underground to a large department store and shopping complex. It is a fair price for a Japanese business hotel. As per most Japanese hotels the service borders on fawning, the cleanliness is immaculate, and the standard rooms are small by American standards. For a single business person, the size is fine. The big downside is that Wifi is only available in the lobby, but it worked flawlessly. I have heard that the nearby Westin has nicer rooms for about the same price, but the location can't be beat.
reviews.title: Convenient Location

reviews.text: This hotel is a very short walk from the bullet train tracks. It is quiet and has excellent staff. The interior is a bit on the older side, but the rooms are quiet functional. The resturants are very good. However, Wifi is only available sitting in the middle of the lobby. Overall, it is probably hard to beat for the price.
reviews.title: Great staff and location for working in Sendai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel sits right at Sendai JR station and adjacent to a department store with a huge range of places to eat - so well connected that you don't even need to go outside to go to the station, shopping or dining - which is great given the heat and humidity in summer (or cold in winter).
reviews.title: Great location
